ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a good course to get general idea about the approaches used for bioinformatics.
yes, very useful for biostatical analysis
Actually you can learn a lot about sequencing, alignment and modeling, but if Corey still teaches and you do not like physics formulas, my suggestion is to audit the course.
good course for the basic bioinformatics
It is a good course. If you are a CBB student, you definitely should take it.
very broad introduction to the topic of bioinformatics.

I would not recommend this course to anyone who values their time. It does not cater to any one discipline and does not go sufficiently in depth into any one area to be useful to anyone. Half the time it seemed like the professors were deciding the direction of the course on the fly. This course needs to be redesigned and retaught.
I'd recommend it only if Corey is not one of the teachers.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Some topics are really useful, but some others are unrelated.
gave me more exposure to informatics and available research tools
good to learn the background knowledge of bioinformatics
This is a core course in my department. It is very useful for my research.
It made me realize that this is not a subject one can learn from other people.
